Handover (Aug - Sep 2011)

This page will document everything that is done to handover the BioCatalogue stuff mainly to Robert Haines, under the BioVel project.

IMPORTANT

  • Accounts, Passwords, Mailing Lists info page

Misc

On 2011-08-03

Added Rob to:

  • BioCatalogue Google Calendar (but maybe we this can be subsumed into another calendar?)
  • As an admin to the RubyForge repository
  • The wiki
  • The internal BioCatalogue mailing list - project management decisions and discussions (fairly low traffic).
    • The admin page for this: http://listserv.manchester.ac.uk/cgi-bin/wa?LMGT1
  • The biocatalogue-developers mailing list - code commit reports; JIRA bug reports and changes; service monitoring emails; biocat error emails; internal developer discussions and so on (very high traffic) [I tend to filter these into about 4 different folders depending on the emails].
    • The admin page for this: http://rubyforge.org/mailman/admin/biocatalogue-developers
  • The biocatalogue-hackers mailing list - public API/tool hackers list (practically no traffic at the mo; maybe should be disbanded).
    • The admin page for this: http://rubyforge.org/mailman/admin/biocatalogue-hackers
  • The biocatalogue-friends mailing list - community mailing list for the biocatalogue (practically no traffic at the mo).
    • The admin page for this: http://listserv.manchester.ac.uk/cgi-bin/wa?LMGT1
  • The biocatalogue-support mailing list - support list for responding to people who email contact@biocatalogue.org or contact us via the website; also receives some systems emails from EBI (fairly low traffic).
    • The admin page for this: http://rubyforge.org/mailman/admin/biocatalogue-support
  • biocatalogue-SAB mailing list admin: http://listserv.manchester.ac.uk/cgi-bin/wa?LMGT1
  • The new docs site
  • [TODO] The JIRA bug tracker
  • The BioCatalogue shared dropbox folder.
